Both Brack and Slark walk along the entire length of Longshore in Westfall. Slark spawns every 1.5-2.5 hours at the very top of Longshore in the north. This guy runs. And runs. And runs.... and runs.... ><. . I chased him about from the Gold Coast Quarry to just north of the Pumpkin Farm, always just out of reach from my Priest's SW:P. name: Chicken
location: Duskwood, Elwynn Forest, Dustwallow Marsh, The Barrens, Westfall

comments.text: You could get a special chicken pet from one of these chickens in Westfall. You can do this "secret" quest as follows... . . Head to Sal-deans' Farm in Westfall and find a chicken. Begin by doing the "Chicken Dance" emote by targeting the chicken and typing "/chicken". Be patient as it could take 100 times or more. Soon you'll see the message, 'Chicken looks at you quizzically. Maybe you should inspect it'. Accept the quest and purchase the special chicken feed from Farmer Saldean. Return to the chicken and type "/cheer" before feeding the chicken. Do this right and the chicken will lay an egg. This egg is your new pet, a prairie chicken. . . Note: This quest can also be found here - https://classicdb.ch/?quest=3861

if you do /chicken around 50-75 times the chicken will have a "!" above his head then you receieve a quest saying to get the "Special Chicken Feed". you get that from farmer saldean in westfall. then be sure to target the chicken and type /cheer. then the "?" will you'll receieve your chicken egg!
Chickens in Shattrath respawn in 6:20mins :p. . No, I'm not bored
Eggs are not bound to the quest doer, and therefore can be ninjaed if you're too lazy to do the quest :]

Oddly enough, the fawns that are grouped with these deer can often have more health than the deer itself.
He spawns at (44, 69) right in front of the Blacksmith building in Moonbrook, perhaps every five minutes.

He respawns after someone has killed him, the respawn rate isn't time based.. . I always find him by starting at Jangolode Mine, follow the road south, take a quick look at the entrance to the cave at the Gold Coast Quarry and then back to the road again down to Moonbrook.. If you haven't found him by then he's probably dead and will respawn in front of the Blacksmith.

in case you're competing with others for him when he spawns, the exact coordinates of his spawn point are 44, 69.&nbsp That's right in front of the blacksmith for those without a coordinate mod installed.
He Spawns in Moonbrook, just outside the blacksmith.

Moonbrook seems to be constantly camped... so is is hard to grab him when he first spawns. I have better luck catching him right outside the Gold Coast Quarry.Just go inside from the East and he will run and out of the Quarry.. Loc 31, 42.
If you want to kill him, at about 30% hp slow him, he runs faster then rogue in sprint. Watch out for that!

Be really careful fighting these guys, their fireballs hit hard for their level. And if you get another add you are in for a ride.. My tip is to try and pull them back away from the the other NPCs so they dont run and aggro, if you need help pulling them back, try running behind a building and waiting for them to come to you.. . Hope that helped.

Basically the deadliest low level creature of them all. For their level their fireballs will take a decent chunk out of your life that is basically unresistable by any class, and they usually have a habit of coming in packs of 2 or spawning right behind you while fighting another mob in Westfall. Fighting these with caution will make everyone better players :D

These mobs have always been at least in the top 20 of the 'Most Dangerous Creatures' list, having killed so many players.. Deadliness confirmed. ). . http://www.wow-europe.com/en/info/gamestats/gamestats.html?en
According to Blizzard, this mob kills more players than any other mob in the game.
I can understand why....70+ fireballs at that level are deadly

Yes, the Defias Pillagers probably are the most dangerous mob for anyone who is around it's level, because it can slay many 14s and 15s with 4 or 5 of their deadly Fireballs. Like Onnissia said, trying to take two or more of these when you're around their level is suicide.
In the upcoming patch 2.3, the amount of damage that their fireballs can do are now reduced. Once that patch is released, this mob will no longer become one of the most dangerous mobs in the game.
Located upstairs in the inn in the back bedroom.
Both Hordes and Allies can repair here.

they throw daggers at range, and melee when close to you. Mostly found with Defias Trappers, if the defias trappers net you any Defias Smugglers at melee range will run to range and start throwing daggers again.
A fair amount of Defias Trappers and Smugglers are located at Molsen Farm @ 45, 40 in Westfall.
I just killed one of these and it was unlootable, is that right?

I doubt anyone will read this, what with these being non-quest and run of the mill mobs, but I'll recount it anyway. As I was running my rogue to the top of the tower to practice lock picking, the two Defias Tower Patrollers started having a conversation. It turns out that they're called Raven and Jill.. . J: Hey, Raven.... (Other patroller comes running to stand in front of the speaker). R: Yea?. J: Can we take a break? My feet are killing me and those ... those things down there are creeping me out.. R: Klaven doesn't pay me enough to deal with zombies, drones, or whatever he calls 'em. I don't know Jill. If Klaven comes down while we're slacking, we might end up as one of those things!. J: *Sigh* You're probably right, Raven. I'm going back on patrol.... . I thought it was a nice little scene, giving a life to non-entity NPC. Nearly made me feel bad about killing them.

A fair amount of Defias Trappers and Smugglers are located at Molsen Farm . @ 45, 40 in Westfall. There is also a small camp of them located over a hill behind the farm at 48, 46.. . [i][small]Edited, Mar 17th 2007 5:53pm by Sorvendall[/small][/i]
this mob is proof that npc's cheat, these can backstab you from the front!!

There are precisely 12 of these mobs in the zone. The clusters on the map are due solely to the fact that they wander around a bit more than the average mob.

Should be noted that these mechanical scarecrows maintain a few properties that separate them from the general NPC population of Westfall.. . First, they have an increased aggro range. Somewhere in the vicinity of 1.5x to 2x the regular radius. This also applies to stealth, while they do not have true sight, the range that they will detect you is increased. They're not called "Watcher"s for nothing.. . Rogues should also note that, since they are mechanical, they are immune to Gouge. Sinister Strike spam is your only practical option.

He says this when he spawns: . . *Klaven Mortwake wildly flips through the pages of a large tome.* . "The sweet irony -- Stormwind forces cut down in defense of their city, only to rise and fight alongside the Brotherhood as instruments of destruction." . "And should one die, two shall rise!" . *Klaven Mortwake shuffles through the books.* . "Now where did I put the Venture Company formulations?" . . and that's it. lol I think it's neat to see what all the NPC's say and what they add to the storyline.

Playing a 60 Druid, I was grinding out some Stormwind rep by doing low level quests and I found this guy down in a tower (coords: 70, 74) in a place I'd never been before, even on a human character. So I went up into the tower to do some exploring and came across this NPC. He dropped about 3 silver and nothing else so I looked him up here to see what he's all about. Given that the loot on the list above has a journal that's a quest item, I'm assuming he's for a quest. Lovely deduction there, right? But where does the quest start? Hm....
He appears to be for a rogue quest. Similar to the tower near Sludge Fen in the Barrens.

Correctomundo.. . The journal you get from the Rogue Quest implies that he has some sort of weakness, possible making him soloable by lower-level rogues.&nbsp I'll try out a few things.. . A lucky [b]ambush[/b] got him down to about 80% (@ 22).&nbsp I got him down below half health before vanishing so he didn't splat me.&nbsp With his counterpart in the Barrens ambush does something like 50% damage, so I'm assuming this isn't his weakness.. . After the vanish CD had expires, I tried opening with a garrote to see if that had any special effects.&nbsp It didn't.&nbsp After that I tried a couple of finishing moves with SS, none of which helped get him back down to half health.&nbsp I'll see what effects Feint and Rupture have (if any) before calling it a day.. . [b]EDIT:[/b]&nbsp He's bugged up right now, refusing to take any damage while continuing to dish it out.&nbsp If anyone has any info on the effects of rogue-specific abilities on him then it's be great.. . It's worth noting that apart from both blades being poisoned my gear isn't great at this point, but I could probably take him down if I felt particularly like breaking out a potion, blowing a couple of CDs and trusting a large part to luck.

These guys can be annoying at low lvls, they run away at 30% health and run much faster then you can, try and really get them killed fast when their health gets low or you can end up agroing 1/2 the cave trying to get them as they run away. . . Edit: and it really isn't worth chasing them if they start to get away, they only agro other kobolds and not the defias members.

This is rumour control. Here are the facts: . . Leprithus and his two Rotten Ghoul companions spawn at the same time every day: approximately 8:00 pm server time. Do not confuse his spawn time with that of the ghouls in the Moonbrook graveyard - those ghouls spawn in place of the normal buzzards at 9:00 pm daily, when game "day" turns to game "night". Since Leprithus spawns an hour earlier, it's safe to assume that these two incidents are not connected or dependent upon one another.. . With the coming of Deathwing, this particular rare spawn lost the quality that once made him so unusual - the fact that he was a "double spawn". Pre-Cataclysm, [i]another[/i] copy of Leprithus and his pals would also spawn at the same time in a small defile in the hills south of the Dust Plains, at 56,80 (also in a small three-grave cemetery). . . Unlike their stationary northern twins, the southern Leprithus and his ghouls would path northeast across the Dust Plain, towards the covered bridge that leads from Westfall to Duskwood. If they made it to the bridge unopposed by the old People's Militia patrol, they would stop for a few moments, then commence wandering about in the area between the road and the mage tower, and through some of the nearby knoll camps.. . [u]Leprithus now only spawns at the northern location - 42,29 in the small graveyard.[/u] His two unique green drops, the Ghoulfang sword and the Ghoul Fingers gloves, are still on his loot table, but I've yet to see either item drop since the launch of Cataclysm (or appear in the auction house).

if he doesn't have the key on him, you have to wait for him to despawn/respawn...usually happens after he does a few rounds around the tower. I've done the quest a few times and it seems like he resists pickpocketing more often when he doesn't have the key on him. It's been said that mobs have a line-of-sight in their programming, so if you keep behind him after he respawns...the odds of a successful snatch are in your favor.

comments.text: The Defias Traitor starts the quest only from one location. He is standing at the Sentinel Hill tower, near Gryan Stoutmantle. . . If he is not there it means someone has already started the quest and you will have to wait for him to respawn. Same goes if you fail the quest. Just abandon it and start it again. . . The locations on the map above actually show the route on which you have to escort the Defias Traitor.

"the defias traitor" is part of a long quest series called "the defias brotherhood". you'll get to a point where Gryan Stoutmantle will ask you to escort the traitor, who can be found at the bottom of the ramp, to moonbrook. the earliest this quest line starts (that i could find!) is when Gryan Stoutmantle wants you to talk to Wiley in Lakeshire.. hope this helps!
